Events.html: 539 BC – Cyrus the Great marches into the city of Babylon, releasing the Jews from almost 70 years of exile. Cyrus allows the Jews to return to Yehud Medinata and rebuild the Temple in Jerusalem.
Events.text: Cyrus the Great marches into the city of Babylon, releasing the Jews from almost 70 years of exile. Cyrus allows the Jews to return to Yehud Medinata and rebuild the Temple in Jerusalem.

Events.html: 456 – Battle of Placentia: Ricimer, supported by Majorian (comes domesticorum), defeats the Roman usurper Avitus near Piacenza (Northern Italy) .
Events.text: Battle of Placentia: Ricimer, supported by Majorian (comes domesticorum), defeats the Roman usurper Avitus near Piacenza (Northern Italy) .

Events.html: 1091 – London Tornado of 1091: A tornado thought to be of strength T8/F4 strikes the heart of London.
Events.text: London Tornado of 1091: A tornado thought to be of strength T8/F4 strikes the heart of London.

Events.html: 1346 – Battle of Neville's Cross: King David II of Scotland is captured by the English near Durham, and imprisoned in the Tower of London for eleven years.
Events.text: Battle of Neville's Cross: King David II of Scotland is captured by the English near Durham, and imprisoned in the Tower of London for eleven years.

Events.html: 1448 – Second Battle of Kosovo, where the mainly Hungarian army led by John Hunyadi is defeated by an Ottoman army led by Sultan Murad II.
Events.text: Second Battle of Kosovo, where the mainly Hungarian army led by John Hunyadi is defeated by an Ottoman army led by Sultan Murad II.

Events.html: 1456 – The University of Greifswald is established, making it the second oldest university in northern Europe (also for a period the oldest in Sweden, and Prussia).
Events.text: The University of Greifswald is established, making it the second oldest university in northern Europe (also for a period the oldest in Sweden, and Prussia).

Events.html: 1558 – Poczta Polska, the Polish postal service, is founded.
Events.text: Poczta Polska, the Polish postal service, is founded.

links.subject: is founded
links.title: Postage stamps and postal history of Poland

Events.html: 1604 – Kepler's Star: German astronomer Johannes Kepler observes a supernova in the constellation Ophiuchus.
Events.text: Kepler's Star: German astronomer Johannes Kepler observes a supernova in the constellation Ophiuchus.

Events.html: 1610 – French king Louis XIII is crowned in Rheims.
Events.text: French king Louis XIII is crowned in Rheims.

Events.html: 1660 – Nine regicides, the men who signed the death warrant of Charles I, are hanged, drawn and quartered.
Events.text: Nine regicides, the men who signed the death warrant of Charles I, are hanged, drawn and quartered.

links.subject: Nine regicides
links.title: List of regicides of Charles I

Events.html: 1662 – Charles II of England sells Dunkirk to France for 40,000 pounds.
Events.text: Charles II of England sells Dunkirk to France for 40,000 pounds.

Events.html: 1771 – Premiere in Milan of the opera Ascanio in Alba, composed by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, age 15.
Events.text: Premiere in Milan of the opera Ascanio in Alba, composed by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, age 15.

Events.html: 1777 – American Revolutionary War: British General John Burgoyne surrenders his army at Saratoga, New York.
Events.text: American Revolutionary War: British General John Burgoyne surrenders his army at Saratoga, New York.

Events.html: 1781 – American Revolutionary War: British General Lord Charles Cornwallis surrenders at the Siege of Yorktown.
Events.text: American Revolutionary War: British General Lord Charles Cornwallis surrenders at the Siege of Yorktown.

Events.html: 1800 – Britain takes control of the Dutch colony of Curaçao.
Events.text: Britain takes control of the Dutch colony of Curaçao.

Events.html: 1806 – Former leader of the Haitian Revolution, Emperor Jacques I of Haiti is assassinated after an oppressive rule.
Events.text: Former leader of the Haitian Revolution, Emperor Jacques I of Haiti is assassinated after an oppressive rule.

Events.html: 1860 – First The Open Championship (referred to in North America as the British Open).
Events.text: First The Open Championship (referred to in North America as the British Open).

Events.html: 1861 – 19 people are killed in the Cullin-La-Ringo massacre, the deadliest massacre of Europeans by aborigines in Australian history.
Events.text: 19 people are killed in the Cullin-La-Ringo massacre, the deadliest massacre of Europeans by aborigines in Australian history.

Events.html: 1888 – Thomas Edison files a patent for the Optical Phonograph (the first movie).
Events.text: Thomas Edison files a patent for the Optical Phonograph (the first movie).

Events.html: 1905 – The October Manifesto issued by Tsar Nicholas II of Russia
Events.text: The October Manifesto issued by Tsar Nicholas II of Russia

Events.html: 1907 – Guglielmo Marconi's company begins the first commercial transatlantic wireless service between Glace Bay, Nova Scotia, Canada and Clifden, Ireland.
Events.text: Guglielmo Marconi's company begins the first commercial transatlantic wireless service between Glace Bay, Nova Scotia, Canada and Clifden, Ireland.

Events.html: 1912 – Bulgaria, Greece and Serbia declare war on the Ottoman Empire, joining Montenegro in the First Balkan War.
Events.text: Bulgaria, Greece and Serbia declare war on the Ottoman Empire, joining Montenegro in the First Balkan War.

Events.html: 1917 – First British bombing of Germany in World War I.
Events.text: First British bombing of Germany in World War I.

Events.html: 1919 – RCA is incorporated as the Radio Corporation of America.
Events.text: RCA is incorporated as the Radio Corporation of America.

Events.html: 1931 – Al Capone convicted of income tax evasion.
Events.text: Al Capone convicted of income tax evasion.

Events.html: 1933 – Albert Einstein flees Nazi Germany and moves to the United States.
Events.text: Albert Einstein flees Nazi Germany and moves to the United States.

Events.html: 1941 – For the first time in World War II, a German submarine attacks an American ship.
Events.text: For the first time in World War II, a German submarine attacks an American ship.

Events.html: 1941 – German troops execute the male population of the villages Kerdyllia in Serres, Greece.
Events.text: German troops execute the male population of the villages Kerdyllia in Serres, Greece.

Events.html: 1943 – Burma Railway (Burma-Thailand Railway) is completed.
Events.text: Burma Railway (Burma-Thailand Railway) is completed.

Events.html: 1943 – The Holocaust: Sobibor extermination camp is closed.
Events.text: The Holocaust: Sobibor extermination camp is closed.

Events.html: 1945 – A massive number of people, headed by CGT, gather in the Plaza de Mayo in Argentina to demand Juan Peron's release. It calls "el día de la lealtad peronista" (peronista loyalty day)
Events.text: A massive number of people, headed by CGT, gather in the Plaza de Mayo in Argentina to demand Juan Peron's release. It calls "el día de la lealtad peronista" (peronista loyalty day)

links.subject: CGT
links.title: Confederación General del Trabajo de la República Argentina

Events.html: 1945 – Archbishop Damaskinos of Athens becomes Prime Minister of Greece between the pull-out of the German occupation force in 1944 and the return of King Georgios II to Greece.
Events.text: Archbishop Damaskinos of Athens becomes Prime Minister of Greece between the pull-out of the German occupation force in 1944 and the return of King Georgios II to Greece.

Events.html: 1956 – The first commercial nuclear power station is officially opened by Queen Elizabeth II in Sellafield,in Cumbria, England.
Events.text: The first commercial nuclear power station is officially opened by Queen Elizabeth II in Sellafield,in Cumbria, England.

links.subject: Queen Elizabeth II
links.title: Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom

Events.html: 1956 – Donald Byrne and Bobby Fischer play a famous chess game called The Game of the Century. Fischer beat Byrne and wins a Brilliancy prize.
Events.text: Donald Byrne and Bobby Fischer play a famous chess game called The Game of the Century. Fischer beat Byrne and wins a Brilliancy prize.

Events.html: 1961 – Scores of Algerian protesters (some claim up to 400) are massacred by the Paris police at the instigation of former Nazi collaborator Maurice Papon, then chief of the Prefecture of Police.
Events.text: Scores of Algerian protesters (some claim up to 400) are massacred by the Paris police at the instigation of former Nazi collaborator Maurice Papon, then chief of the Prefecture of Police.

Events.html: 1964 – Prime Minister of Australia Robert Menzies opens the artificial Lake Burley Griffin in the middle of the capital Canberra.
Events.text: Prime Minister of Australia Robert Menzies opens the artificial Lake Burley Griffin in the middle of the capital Canberra.

Events.html: 1965 – The 1964-1965 New York World's Fair closes after a two year run. More than 51 million people had attended the two-year event.
Events.text: The 1964-1965 New York World's Fair closes after a two year run. More than 51 million people had attended the two-year event.

Events.html: 1966 – A fire at a building in New York City kills 12 firefighters, the fire department's deadliest day until the September 11, 2001 attacks.
Events.text: A fire at a building in New York City kills 12 firefighters, the fire department's deadliest day until the September 11, 2001 attacks.

Events.html: 1966 – Botswana and Lesotho join the United Nations.
Events.text: Botswana and Lesotho join the United Nations.

Events.html: 1970 – Montreal, Quebec: Quebec Vice-Premier and Minister of Labour Pierre Laporte murdered by members of the FLQ terrorist group.
Events.text: Montreal, Quebec: Quebec Vice-Premier and Minister of Labour Pierre Laporte murdered by members of the FLQ terrorist group.

Events.html: 1973 – OPEC starts an oil embargo against a number of western countries, considered to have helped Israel in its war against Syria.
Events.text: OPEC starts an oil embargo against a number of western countries, considered to have helped Israel in its war against Syria.

Events.html: 1977 – German Autumn: Four days after it is hijacked, Lufthansa Flight 181 lands in Mogadishu, Somalia, where a team of German GSG 9 commandos later rescues all remaining hostages on board.
Events.text: German Autumn: Four days after it is hijacked, Lufthansa Flight 181 lands in Mogadishu, Somalia, where a team of German GSG 9 commandos later rescues all remaining hostages on board.

Events.html: 1979 – Mother Teresa awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.
Events.text: Mother Teresa awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.

Events.html: 1979 – The Department of Education Organization Act is signed into law creating the US Department of Education and US Department of Health and Human Services.
Events.text: The Department of Education Organization Act is signed into law creating the US Department of Education and US Department of Health and Human Services.

links.subject: US Department of Health and Human Services
links.title: US Department of Health and Human Services

Events.html: 1980 – As part of the Holy See – United Kingdom relations a British monarch makes the first state visit to the Vatican
Events.text: As part of the Holy See – United Kingdom relations a British monarch makes the first state visit to the Vatican

Events.html: 1989 – 1989 Loma Prieta earthquake (7.1 on the Richter scale) hits the San Francisco Bay Area and causes 57 deaths directly (and 6 indirectly).
Events.text: 1989 Loma Prieta earthquake (7.1 on the Richter scale) hits the San Francisco Bay Area and causes 57 deaths directly (and 6 indirectly).

Events.html: 1992 – Having gone to the wrong house for a Halloween party, Japanese exchange student Yoshihiro Hattori is shot and killed by the homeowner in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
Events.text: Having gone to the wrong house for a Halloween party, Japanese exchange student Yoshihiro Hattori is shot and killed by the homeowner in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

Events.html: 1994 – Russian journalist Dmitry Kholodov is assassinated while investigating corruption in the armed forces.
Events.text: Russian journalist Dmitry Kholodov is assassinated while investigating corruption in the armed forces.

Events.html: 2000 – Train crash at Hatfield, north of London, leading to collapse of Railtrack.
Events.text: Train crash at Hatfield, north of London, leading to collapse of Railtrack.

Events.html: 2001 – Israeli tourism minister Rehavam Ze'evi became the first Israeli minister to be assassinated in a terrorist attack.
Events.text: Israeli tourism minister Rehavam Ze'evi became the first Israeli minister to be assassinated in a terrorist attack.

Events.html: 2003 – The pinnacle is fitted on the roof of Taipei 101, a 101-floor skyscraper in Taipei, allowing it to surpass the Petronas Twin Towers in Kuala Lumpur by 56 metres (184 ft) and become the world's tallest highrise.
Events.text: The pinnacle is fitted on the roof of Taipei 101, a 101-floor skyscraper in Taipei, allowing it to surpass the Petronas Twin Towers in Kuala Lumpur by 56 metres (184 ft) and become the world's tallest highrise.
